channel.title: Help on running a server on mac
channel.description:
Hello im trying to find a way how to make a server on a mac, ive been using this tutorial http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=442856.0 but i got this problem when i press enter on terminal [quote] bash /Users/hannymakawi/Desktop/Untitledaa.sh /Users/hannymakawi/Desktop/Untitledaa.sh: line 1: cd: /Users/hannymakawi/Desktop/Trisidia-\ Source: No such file or directory javac: file not found: *.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: server at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:202) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:247)/quote]
if there is any other tutorials i can use that would be appreciated

item.title: Help on running a server on mac
item.dc:creator: @hanny hanny
item.source: Help on running a server on mac

item.title: Help on running a server on mac
item.dc:creator: @Driman_Rune Driman Rune
item.description:
@Driman_Rune wrote:

I have no idea, but it means the source files are not right, or something, I don’t know.

What source are you using?

You’ll get this if you run a 2006scape source.

Read full topic
item.source: Help on running a server on mac

@hanny wrote:

oh do you know any tutorials i can use on how to make a server on a mac

Read full topic

item.title: Help on running a server on mac
item.dc:creator: @Driman_Rune Driman Rune
item.description:
@Driman_Rune wrote:

If you look closely their is no file or directory.

Meaning, that your not using it right.

javac: file not found: *.java
Usage: javac

It means one of the files you’re trying to compile is not working. I get this with 2006scape source.

Read full topic
item.source: Help on running a server on mac

item.title: Help on running a server on mac
item.dc:creator: @hanny hanny
item.description:
@hanny wrote:

Hello im trying to find a way how to make a server on a mac, ive been using this tutorial http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=442856.0 but i got this problem when i press enter on terminal

[quote] bash /Users/hannymakawi/Desktop/Untitledaa.sh
/Users/hannymakawi/Desktop/Untitledaa.sh: line 1: cd: /Users/hannymakawi/Desktop/Trisidia-\ Source: No such file or directory
javac: file not found: *.java
Usage: javac
use -help for a list of possible options
Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: server
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:202)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:247)/quote]

if there is any other tutorials i can use that would be appreciated

Read full topic
